H0.text: Carbon monoxide (CO) is a secondary pollutant produced in the environment by chemical reactions involving primary or emitted chemicals.

H1.text: Nitrogen oxide (NO) is a secondary pollutant produced in the environment by chemical reactions involving primary or emitted chemicals.

H2.text: Methane (CH₄) is a secondary pollutant produced in the environment by chemical reactions involving primary or emitted chemicals.

H3.text: Ozone (O₃) is a secondary pollutant produced in the environment by chemical reactions involving primary or emitted chemicals.

A4.text: Ground-level ozone is formed naturally as a secondary pollutant through photochemical reactions involving nitrogen oxides and volatile organic compounds in the presence of bright sunshine with high temperatures.

A5.text: NOx, CO, and VOCs are considered ozone precursors.
